Problem:
Consider a complex function \\( z(t) \\) governed by the differential equation \\( \\dot{z} = iz \\), where i is the imaginary unit. We examine the effects of applying a transformation \\( f(z) = e^{At}z \\) to the system, where A is a constant complex matrix.

If the transformation \\( f(z) \\) is applied to the initial condition \\( z_0 \\) at t = 0 and the system then evolves according to \\( \\dot{z} = iz \\) without further interventions, will \\( z(t) \\) at any t > 0 be the same as if \\( z_0 \\) evolved naturally under \\( \\dot{z} = iz \\)?
Explanation: The transformation \\( f(z) = e^{At}z \\) modifies the initial state by a multiplicative factor that evolves with time, changing the trajectory of the system from what would be produced by the natural evolution under \\( \\dot{z} = iz \\).
